message.content: Most men in South Sudan hold traditional beliefs and attitudes towards divorce, considering it a taboo and a social taboo. They view marriage as a lifelong commitment, and divorce is seen as a failure and a disgrace to the family. Men generally have a strong preference for maintaining a stable and intact marriage, even in the face of challenges or unhappy relationships. Divorce is often perceived as socially unacceptable and may lead to stigma and a loss of social status for both the man and his family.
